div.l: ¶ This Carpenter owt of his slvmber sterte
And herde oon cryen water as hee were wood
And thowghtte allas now comyht Noes flood
And sette hym vppe wtith owten wordis moo
And wtith an axe hee smote the cordis on twoo
A down gooht al hee fonde nowther to selle
Breed nor ale till hee come to thee celle
Vppon thee floore and theer a swovne he lay
¶ Vp sterte here Alisovn and Nicholay
And criden owt and harrow in thee strete
Thee neyghebouris bothe smale and greete
In they rvnne forto gawre on this man
That a swovne lay bothe pale and wan
For wtith that fall brosten hee hath is arm
But stonden hee moste to his owne harm
For whanne hee spacke hee was born down
Wtith hendy Nicholas and wtith Alisovn
¶ They tolden every man that hee was wood
He was so agast offe Noyes flood
Thorghw fantasye that offe his vanitee
Hee hadde bowght hym knedynge tubbis three
And hadde hangged hem in the Rowf a bove
And that hee preyde hem for goddis love
To sitten in thee rowf per cvmpanye
¶ Thee folkis gan to lawghen atte his fantesye
In to thee rowf / they kyken and they gape
And they turneden alle is harm into a iape
For what so evere this Carpenter ansswerde
It was fore nowght no man his resovn herde
Wtith othes grete hee was so sworn down
That hee was holden wood in to all that town
For every clerk annon Ryght heeld wtith other
They seyde this man is wood my leue brother
And every wyght gan lawghen atte his stryif
¶ Thus swivid was thee carpenteris wyif
For all his kepyngge ⁊ his ielosye
And absolon hath kest here nether Eeye
And Nicholas is skalded in his towte
This tale is doon god save all this Rowte
¶ Explicit fabula Molendinarii
¶ Here be gynniht the ꝓprolog͗e of the Revis tale
Whanne folk hadde lawghed at this nyse caas
Of Absolon and of of hendy Nicholas
Diverse folkis diversly they seyde
But fore the moste part they lowgh ⁊and pleyde
Ne atte his tale I sawe no man hem greve
But it were Only Osewald the Reve
By cavze hes was of thee carpenteris craft
¶ Alytill ire in his hertte was laft
He gan to gructhe ⁊and blamede it alyte
So theik qduod hee ful well cowthe I the quite
Wᵗith bleryngge of a prowd Melnere is Eeye
Yif that mee lyste to speke of Rebawdye
But I am olde me list not pleye for Age
Gras tyme is done my foddre is forage
This white top writyht myne oolde yeris
Myin hertte is also movled as myne heris
¶ But yif I fare as dooht an open ers
That ilke frewte is evere lengere the wers
Tille it bee Roten in Mullok ore in stree
Wee Oolde men I drede so fare wee
Till we bee Roten can wee nowt bee Ripe
Wee hoppen alwey while the world will pipe
Fore in owre will be be theer stekyht alwey anayille
To haven an hoor heer and a grete tayille
As hath a leeke for thowgh owre myght bee goon
Owre will desyriht folye evere in oon
For whaıı̄nne wee may not doon thanne woll wee sp
¶ Yit in owr asschis Oolde is fyir efy efyire I reke
Fowre gledis have of the wyche I schall devise
Avawntyngge lykyngge Anger and coveytise
This fowre sparkis sparkles longyht vnto eelde
Owre oolde lymis Mowen well been vn weelde
But will ne schall nowt faylen that is sooht
And yit have I alwey a coltis tooht
As manye a yeer as it is passed henne
Syne my tappe of lyif bygangan bygan forto Renne
